pros:
Supportive and caring community.  

Many opportunities to learn, grow professionally, and improve things within the University.  Particularly for self-directed personnel. 

Very competitive benefits package, especially when compared to other organizations.
-Multiple medical plans to choose from, dental & vision standard, generous vacation, sick, and personal time. Vacation and PTO increases based on length of service.  

Boulder is a beautiful and fun place to work.
cons:
Hard to stay focused on any single thing for long.  Too many things going on, too many demands placed (often unknowingly) on the workforce.  Highest levels of management (including the board) often don't understand what it takes to make many of their initiatives reality. 

Frequent complaints from co-workers who feel they are undervalued (more common among faculty than staff).  The frequent complaining can lead to a larger sense of discontent in the workplace.  In my opinion: those employees need to take a closer look at their total compensation package (which means benefits, holiday time, etc.) and consider all factors. 

The City of Boulder is the most difficult municipality I've ever had to work in and with. Tremendous amounts of red-tape, delays, reviews, opinions, etc.  (May not be relevant to most potential employees).

pros: Balance of work and home

job_title: Director of Admissions in Boulder, CO
pros: PTO is generous. Tuition benefit is also great if you're looking for a degree in an area of study that Naropa offers. The people (students & colleagues) are wonderful; there's a shared mission and purpose that brings everyone together. Contemplative practice opportunities and instruction are available. cons: No retirement match. No remote work policy. General resistance to change throughout the organization. Everyone that works there cares very deeply about the school, so the stakes feel incredibly high and we can't/won't make necessary decisions to stay afloat.

review_title: Good first job. Average everything else
job_title: Theater Technician II in Boulder, CO
pros: This was a great first job for me. Working in the theater was rewarding and I enjoyed my coworkers. The job was very relaxed and we had a lot of fun while working. The pay was good compared to other first jobs I could have applied for.
cons:
Never had an employee review in the 13 months I worked here, even though they were promised every 6 months.

I would constantly hear from the event department administrators that the middle management had no idea what they were talking about and it was fully of administrative bloat.

Hours were all over the place, but that's part of the nature of theater work and is not unique to this job.

I heard there was a very high turn over once I left. Seems like everyone who know what they were doing left for a better job, with my competent management.

Parking is very limited at the Arapahoe campus, and I would be ticketed by the student parking police for not buying their parking pass. Luckily their fines aren't enforceable unless you are a student.

pros: Location in Boulder, co-workers, working with students
cons: Very negative work atmosphere, unhappy employees, weak benefits and getting worse, pay raises are non-existent and are currently at poverty level. No signs of improvement in any area. Poorly managed organization. New management was recently hired and has confirmed that benefits and pay will not change. Naropa is a sinking ship and I wouldn't recommend this organization to anyone. Many people have already left, or are actively seeking other employment. I'm glad I left when I did.
